author: Anjana George
title: Leona Lishoy wishes to help autistic children
text:
Model-turned-actress Leona Lishoy's latest role in PK Baburaj's Gemini has apparently moved her .
The actress, who plays a supportive aunt to an autistic child in the movie, tells us that learning about the plight of autistic children from the movie has made her love them more, and that she wishes to spend time with such kids once she's done with the filming. "Esther Anil plays the role of Gemini, the autistic child in the movie. When I researched about the neuro-developmental disorder, what I found is that such children will be extremely good at something or the other," she says.
Leona's role in the movie too is on similar lines. "I play Gemini's aunt who identifies her strengths and supports her to nurture her skills," she explains, adding she wants to travel and meet such kids soon. Sijoy Varghese plays Gemini's dad in the film, while Tanushree Ghosh, her mother.
Meanwhile, Leona will be also seen in Anish Varma's movie Zoom that has Bhagat Manuel in the lead. "The movie is a humourous investigative thriller in which I will play a model. It's a small role but is of great significance to the story," she signs off.
